learning_path: Fundamentals: Python programming, linear algebra, probability & statistics
Data manipulation with Pandas and NumPy
Supervised and unsupervised learning with scikit-learn
Deep learning basics with TensorFlow or PyTorch
projects: End-to-end Kaggle-style project: dataset cleaning → modeling → deployment
data scientist.notes: Focus on practical projects and a small portfolio to demonstrate skills.

learning_path: Build web APIs with ASP.NET Core
Work with databases using Entity Framework
Deploy to Azure and learn CI/CD pipelines
projects: Microservice that integrates with SQL and exposes endpoints
Deploy an app to Azure App Service with CI/CD
.net.notes: Map .NET knowledge to job descriptions in your region and build a deployable app.

learning_path: Phase 1: Python fundamentals (6-8 weeks) - variables, loops, functions, OOP basics
Phase 2: Selenium WebDriver (4-6 weeks) - installation, basic script, element interactions, waits
Phase 3: Test Design Patterns (3-4 weeks) - Page Object Model, identifying flaky tests, best practices
Phase 4: pytest and Test Organization (2-3 weeks) - runners, fixtures, reporting, test suites
Phase 5: CI/CD Integration (2-3 weeks) - running tests in pipelines, parallel execution, artifacts
projects: Project 1 (Weeks 1-3): Automate 5-10 test cases on a public website using Selenium + pytest
Project 2 (Weeks 4-6): Build a Page Object Model framework with 20+ test cases
Project 3 (Weeks 7-10): Create a regression test suite for an e-commerce app (login, search, checkout)
Project 4 (Weeks 11-14): Integrate tests into CI pipeline with parallel execution and HTML reports
selenium python.career_path: QA Automation Engineer → Test Architect → Engineering Manager
selenium python.job_market: High demand (especially in fintech, e-commerce, enterprise software)
selenium python.notes: Focus on writing reliable, maintainable tests. Learn to diagnose and fix flaky tests. Build a GitHub portfolio with 2-3 real test projects showing POM implementation and CI integration.

learning_path: Learn Python for data: Pandas and NumPy
Build 2-3 ML projects showing business impact
projects: Build a product recommendation model using backend data
Deploy a simple ML model behind an API
fullstack to data scientist.notes: Use your fullstack background to ship ML-enabled features quickly.

learning_path: JavaScript fundamentals and modern ES6+ features
State management with Redux or Context
projects: Single-page application with routing and state
frontend developer.notes: Build polished UI projects and include accessibility checks.

projects: RESTful API with auth and DB
Deploy using Docker and a cloud provider
backend developer.notes: Focus on reliable APIs and clear documentation.

projects: End-to-end ETL pipeline into a data warehouse
Build streaming ingest into analytics store
data engineer.notes: Emphasize reliability, monitoring, and cost-aware design.

learning_path: Deepen ML fundamentals and production concerns
Implement CI for ML and monitoring
projects: Deploy an ML model with autoscaling
Implement end-to-end ML pipeline with monitoring
ml engineer.notes: Bridge ML research and production reliability.

projects: Containerize an app and run on Kubernetes
devops engineer.notes: Focus on reproducible deployments and reliability.

projects: Host a scalable web service on AWS
Build serverless data processing with Lambda

learning_path: Android app architecture and Jetpack components
projects: Build and publish a simple Android app
android developer.notes: Polish UX and follow platform guidelines.

learning_path: Build apps with SwiftUI or UIKit
Test and distribute via App Store
projects: Build and publish an iOS app
ios developer.notes: Focus on platform conventions and performance.

learning_path: Learn product discovery and user research
Understand basic analytics and data interpretation
Write clear PRDs and work with engineering
projects: Define and run an A/B test
Create a product roadmap aligned to metrics
Run customer interviews and synthesize insights
product manager.notes: Build strong domain expertise and communication skills.

learning_path: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-2): Software Testing Fundamentals - types of testing, test cases, SDLC
Phase 2 (Weeks 3-6): Python Basics - variables, loops, functions, OOP, file handling
Phase 3 (Weeks 7-12): Selenium WebDriver - installation, element identification, navigation, interactions
Phase 4 (Weeks 13-16): Wait Strategies - implicit waits, explicit waits, handling timeouts
Phase 5 (Weeks 17-20): Page Object Model - framework design, test organization, best practices
Phase 6 (Weeks 21-24): pytest & Test Management - fixtures, runners, reports, parallel execution
Phase 7 (Weeks 25-28): CI/CD Integration - Jenkins/GitHub Actions, automated test execution, artifact generation
projects: Project 1 (Week 8): Automate 10 test cases on demo.opencart.com (login, search, add to cart)
Project 2 (Week 14): Build POM framework with 30+ test cases for e-commerce site
Project 3 (Week 20): Complete regression suite (UI + API smoke tests) with cross-browser support
Project 4 (Week 28): Integrate tests into GitHub Actions with scheduled execution, Slack notifications, HTML reports
qa automation.career_path: QA Automation Engineer → Senior Automation Engineer → Test Architect → QA Manager
qa automation.job_market: High demand globally, especially in fintech, e-commerce, healthcare, and enterprise software
qa automation.notes: Focus on writing maintainable, reliable tests. Learn to debug flaky tests. Build a GitHub portfolio with 2-3 production-grade test projects. Key success factor: strong debugging and problem-solving skills. Employers value candidates who understand root cause of test failures and can architect scalable test frameworks.

learning_path: Design and execute automated test suites
projects: Build automated test suite for a web application
Create reusable test framework with POM
Set up automated tests in CI pipeline
prerequisite_skills: Basic programming knowledge or willingness to learn
test automation engineer.career_path: Test Automation Engineer → Senior Test Automation Engineer → QA Lead
test automation engineer.notes: Similar to QA Automation Engineer. Focus on framework design and test reliability.

selenium testing.career_path: Selenium Testing Engineer → QA Automation Engineer → Test Architect
selenium testing.job_market: Good demand, especially for e-commerce and SaaS
selenium testing.notes: Specialized role focused on Selenium automation. Emphasize framework reliability and maintainability.

learning_path: Phase 1: C# fundamentals (4-6 weeks) - syntax, OOP, LINQ
Phase 2: Selenium WebDriver with C# (4-6 weeks) - setup, basic scripts, element interactions
Phase 3: Test frameworks (2-4 weeks) - NUnit, SpecFlow, assertions, test runners
Phase 4: Framework design (2-3 weeks) - POM, reusable helpers, reporting
Phase 5: CI/CD integration (2-3 weeks) - pipelines, scheduled runs, artifact management
projects: Automate 5-10 test cases using Selenium + NUnit in C#
Build POM framework in C# with SpecFlow scenarios
Integrate tests into Azure DevOps pipeline with reports
selenium csharp.career_path: QA Automation Engineer (C#) → Senior Automation Engineer → Test Architect
selenium csharp.notes: For teams using Microsoft stack, C# is preferred. Emphasize strong C# fundamentals.

learning_path: Phase 1: Excel essentials and data cleaning (2-3 weeks)
Phase 2: SQL for data querying (3-4 weeks)
Phase 3: Python for data analysis (4-6 weeks) - pandas, numpy
Phase 4: Visualization and dashboards (2-3 weeks) - Power BI/ Tableau
projects: Clean and analyze a dataset in Excel and present findings
Create SQL reports from sample databases
Build a Power BI dashboard showcasing KPIs
document specialist to data analyst.notes: Leverage domain knowledge from document work; focus on transferable skills like attention to detail and data quality.

learning_path: Phase 1: HTML & CSS and responsive design (2-3 weeks)
Phase 3: React basics and component patterns (4-6 weeks)
Phase 4: Build portfolio and deploy (2-3 weeks)
projects: Create a responsive portfolio website showcasing edited photos
Build a React gallery app with filtering and lightbox
Deploy site to Netlify or GitHub Pages
photo editor to frontend developer.notes: Design sensibility from photo editing is an advantage; focus on UX and polished UI.

learning_path: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-2): SQL fundamentals - SELECT, WHERE, JOIN, GROUP BY, aggregates
Phase 2 (Weeks 3-5): Advanced queries - subqueries, CTEs, window functions, complex joins
Phase 3 (Weeks 6-8): Database design - normalization, ER diagrams, constraints, relationships
Phase 4 (Weeks 9-11): Stored procedures and triggers - writing, debugging, performance
Phase 5 (Weeks 12-14): Query optimization - execution plans, indexing strategies, EXPLAIN
Phase 6 (Weeks 15-17): Database administration - backups, recovery, user management, maintenance
Phase 7 (Weeks 18-20): SQL Server/PostgreSQL specific features and cloud databases
projects: Project 1: Design and normalize a database for an e-commerce system (products, orders, customers, inventory)
Project 2: Write 50+ optimized queries for business analytics (sales reports, customer segmentation, trend analysis)
Project 3: Create stored procedures and triggers for order processing with transaction handling
Project 4: Build ETL pipeline extracting data from multiple sources, transforming with SQL, loading into warehouse
Project 5: Performance tuning project - analyze slow queries, identify missing indexes, optimize execution plans
sql engineer.career_path: Junior SQL Developer → Senior SQL Developer → Database Architect → Database Administrator
sql engineer.job_market: Consistently high demand across all industries (finance, healthcare, e-commerce, SaaS)
sql engineer.notes: SQL is a cornerstone skill for data-intensive roles. Strong SQL fundamentals open doors to data engineering, analytics, and backend development. Focus on writing efficient queries and understanding execution plans. Real-world projects with 1M+ row datasets are impressive on portfolios.

generic.notes: If unsure, start with fundamentals and then specialize.

learning_path: Phase 1: Business fundamentals and process understanding (2-3 weeks)
Phase 2: Data analysis with SQL and Excel (3-4 weeks)
Phase 3: Visualization and reporting (Power BI/Tableau) (2-3 weeks)
Phase 4: Requirements elicitation and documentation (2-3 weeks)

business analyst.notes: Strong communication and analytical skills are key. Build a portfolio of analysis projects showing business impact.

ux designer.notes: User empathy is fundamental. Learn to validate designs with real users. Build case studies showing impact.
